channel.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
channel.description:
Okay, so I searched around the internet for about a hour trying to help him fix it but we can't find anything.
I'm able to connect to his RSPS, which means he's portforwarded correctly. This is a PI 317.
He just can't connect to his own one? Any ideas?

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

hmm… if there is somewhere to change the ip on rswebclients have him try connecting to 127.0.0.1 since he is hosting it or if he is using utorrent it maybe be a problem by blocking him from connecting

Read full topic
item.source: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

ownedin3d:

lol, you will need the client, and yes ask him.

You don’t need the client with a RSWebclient. There’s a Client.java in the source files if that’s what you’ll need.

Read full topic

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

ownedin3d:

does your friend got teamviewer, if so pm me the id and the pass, i’ll do it for you.

Just to let you know, he only has the source files. We didn’t use the client AT ALL. It was messed up with 1K+ complier errors and I’m not one to go through all that. xD

I’ll ask him if he wants to?

Read full topic

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

[quote=“ownedin3d, post:14, topic:453769”][quote author=T7S link=topic=556613.msg4074220#msg4074220 date=1344644878]
It’s a webclient. We don’t use the client files…
[/quote]
are you both joining a public, or is it one that one of you host to play with each other?[/quote]

I’m the main owner. I just gave him the files so that he could host it when I’m offline. I’ve gone through all of the ways to get it online so it works fine. Just not for him.

I think it’s public. We have about 5 players online on a average.

Read full topic

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @ownedin3d ownedin3d
item.description:
@ownedin3d wrote:

it’s simple, the guy who is running the server needs to connect to 127.0.0.1. so you should tell youre buddy, to change the download able clients ip to “127.0.0.1” then should could connect normally.

Read full topic

item.title: I can connect to my friends RSPS, but he can't connect to his own?
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

hur911:

well he should wait until something pops up asking him to allow something then he clicks ok, then he has to wait without going to any other windows or else it will white out. Then he can just log in. Thats the price you gotta pay for the easy way out. lol rswebclients

Java pop’s up asking for permission. He clicks yes and accept it. He get to the log-in screen and it says “Error connecting to server”. The error you’re thinking of is “Error loading - Please report!”

Read full topic
